sen.j: 藤原胤子（ふじわら の いんし（たねこ）、生年不詳 - 寛平8年6月30日 (旧暦)（896年8月12日））は、内大臣藤原高藤女。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Inshi (Taneko) (year of her birth is unclear - August 12, 896) was a daughter of Naidaijin (the Minister of the Center) FUJIWARA no Takafuji.
FUJIWARA no Inshi (Taneko) (year of her birth is unclear - August 12, 896) was the daughter of Naidaijin (the Minister of the Center) FUJIWARA no Takafuji.
FUJIWARA no Inshi (Taneko) (year of her birth is unclear - August 16, 896) was the daughter of Naidaijin (the Minister of the Center) FUJIWARA no Takafuji.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.e: Her mother was MIYAJI no Resshi.
Her mother was MIYAJI no Resshi.
Her mother was MIYAJI no Resshi.

sen.j: 第59代宇多天皇女御、第60代醍醐天皇・敦慶親王・敦固親王・柔子内親王・敦実親王生母。
sen.e: She was Nyogo (consort) of the 59th Emperor Uda and the real mother of the 60th Emperor Daigo, Imperial Prince Atsuyoshi, Imperial Prince Atsukata, Imperial Princess Jushi and Imperial Prince Atsumi.
She was Nyogo (consort) of the 59th Emperor Uda and the real mother of the 60th Emperor Daigo, Imperial Prince Atsuyoshi, Imperial Prince Atsukata, Imperial Princess Jushi and Imperial Prince Atsumi.

She was Nyogo (a high-ranking lady in the court (a consort of an emperor)) of the 59th Emperor Uda and the real mother of the 60th Emperor Daigo, Imperial Prince Atsuyoshi, Imperial Prince Atsukata, Imperial Princess Jushi and Imperial Prince Atsumi.
sen.cmt: 女御 補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 同母兄弟に右大臣藤原定方。
sen.e: Udaijin (the Minister of the Right) FUJIWARA no Sadakata was her half brother with the same mother.
Udaijin (the Minister of the Right) FUJIWARA no Sadakata was her half brother by the same mother.
Udaijin (the Minister of the Right) FUJIWARA no Sadakata was her maternal half-brother.
sen.cmt: 同母兄弟 表現を統一しました。

sen.j: 元慶8年（884年）頃、光孝天皇の第七皇子源定省と結婚。
sen.e: She married MINAMOTO no Sadami, the seventh prince of the Emperor Koko, around 884.
She married MINAMOTO no Sadami, the seventh prince of Emperor Koko, around 884.
She married MINAMOTO no Sadami, the seventh prince of Emperor Koko, around 884.

sen.j: 同9年（885年）、長男維城（のち敦仁と改名）を産む。
sen.e: In the same year (885), she gave birth to her eldest son Korezane (later renamed Atsuhito).
In the same year (885), she gave birth to her eldest son Korezane (later renamed Atsuhito).
In 885, she gave birth to her eldest son Korezane (later renamed Atsuhito).

sen.j: 仁和3年（887年）、夫定省が皇族に復帰し即位する（宇多天皇）。
sen.e: In 887. her husband Sadami returned to the Imperial family and ascended the throne (the Emperor Uda).
In 887. her husband Sadami returned to the Imperial family and ascended the throne (Emperor Uda).
In 887, her husband Sadami returned to the Imperial Family and ascended to the throne (Emperor Uda).
sen.cmt: Imperial Family, ascended to the throne としました。ピリオドからカンマに修正しました。

sen.j: 同4年（888年）更衣 (女官)となり、禁色を赦される。
sen.e: In 888, she became Koi (a court lady) and was allowed to use some colors which lower rank court nobles were prohibited to use.
In 888, she became Koi (a court lady) and was allowed to use some colors which lower rank court nobles were prohibited to use.
In 888, she became Koi (a court lady) and was allowed to use some colors which lower rank court nobles were prohibited to use.

sen.j: 寛平4年（892年）1月、従四位下に叙され女御の宣旨を受ける。
sen.e: In January 892, she was conferred the court rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and became Nyogo by the Imperial proclamation.
In January 892, she was conferred the court rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and became Nyogo by Imperial proclamation.
In February 892, she was conferred the court rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) and became Nyogo by Imperial proclamation.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 同年4月、敦仁親王が立太子。
sen.e: In April of the same year, Imperial Prince Atsuhito became the Crown Prince.
In April of the same year, Imperial Prince Atsuhito became the Crown Prince.
In May of the same year, Imperial Prince Atsuhito became the Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.e: She died in August 896.
She died in August 896.
She died in August 896.

sen.j: 同9年、醍醐天皇の即位により皇太后を追贈された。
sen.e: In September of the same year, she was posthumously conferred the title of Kotaigo (Empress dowager) in the wake of the enthronement of the Emperor Daigo.
In September of the same year, she was posthumously conferred the title of Kotaigo (Empress dowager) in the wake of the enthronement of Emperor Daigo.
In 897, she was posthumously conferred the title of Kotaigo (Empress dowager) in the wake of the enthronement of Emperor Daigo.

sen.j: 『今昔物語集』によれば、父高藤が山科へ鷹狩に出かけた際雨宿りをした宇治郡司宮道弥益の家で、弥益の娘宮道列子を見初め一夜の契りでもうけたのが胤子である。
sen.e: According to "Konjaku Monogatari", Inshi was born when her father Takafuji went to Yamashina for falconry, took shelter at the house of Gunji (a local official) MIYAJI no Iyamasu, fell in love with Iyamasu's daughter MIYAJI no Resshi and had an affair with her.

According to "Konjaku Monogatari," Inshi was born when her father Takafuji went to Yamashina for falconry, took shelter at the house of Gunji (a local official) MIYAJI no Iyamasu, fell in love with Iyamasu's daughter MIYAJI no Resshi and had an affair with her.

According to "Konjaku Monogatari Shu " (The Tale of Times Now Past), Inshi was born when her father Takafuji went to Yamashina for falconry, took shelter at the house of Uji Gunji (a local official in Uji) MIYAJI no Iyamasu, fell in love with Iyamasu's daughter MIYAJI no Resshi and had an affair with her.
sen.cmt: 今昔物語集 の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 宇多天皇との間に四男一女をもうけながらも早世した。
sen.e: She died young though she had four sons and a daughter between the Emperor Uda.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: She died young though she had four sons and a daughter with Emperor Uda.
She died young although she had four sons and a daughter with Emperor Uda.

sen.j: しかし、所生の醍醐天皇が即位したことによって高藤は内大臣にまで昇進、胤子の兄弟定方も右大臣となり、同家は以後藤原北家勧修寺流と称されることになった。
sen.e: However, thanks to the enthronement of her son, the Emperor Daigo, Takafuji was promoted to Naidaijin, her brother Sadakata was promoted to Udaijin and since then, her family was called Kajuji line of FUJIWARA North family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, thanks to the enthronement of her son, Emperor Daigo, Takafuji was promoted to Naidaijin, her brother Sadakata was promoted to Udaijin and since then, her family was called Kajuji line of FUJIWARA North family.

However, thanks to the enthronement of her son, Emperor Daigo, Takafuji was promoted to Naidaijin, her brother Sadakata was promoted to Udaijin and since then, her family was called Kanjuji line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 藤原北家勧修寺流→Kanjuji line of the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan としました。

sen.j: 陵墓は小野陵（京都府京都市山科区勧修寺北大日町）。
sen.e: Her Imperial mausoleum is Ono Mausoleum (Kitadainichi-cho, Kanshuji, Yamasina Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).
Her Imperial mausoleum is the Ono Mausoleum (Kitadainichi-cho, Kanshuji, Yamasina Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).
Her Imperial mausoleum is the Ono Mausoleum (Kitadainichi-cho, Kanshuji, Yamashina Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture).
